{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is presenting with delayed speech development, hyperactivity, and a characteristic facial appearance of a long and narrow face. These findings are consistent with Fragile X syndrome, which is a trinucleotide repeat disorder. Fragile X syndrome is caused by an expansion of the CGG trinucleotide repeat in the FMR1 gene on the X chromosome. Therefore, the most likely inheritance pattern of this disorder is X-linked dominant.", "answer_choice": "D"}
